Job Title: Mechanical Technician II

Location: Torrance, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
NSI-MI Technologies is the world leader in the design and delivery of state-of-the-art measurement systems used to verify performance of cutting-edge microwave communications devices. NSI-MI systems are used in many industries to support development of next generation products including satellites, radar, automotive communications, radar cross section, radome testing and many more wireless communications applications.

Overview:

The primary role of this position is to perform advanced mechanical and electrical assembly of various precision assemblies, mechanisms, and positioning systems. The Mechanical Technician II position involves the assembly and installation of a low volume, high technology, high variation product mix, produced in a project driven build-to-order production working environment.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

 Fasten components or parts together, using hand tools, rivet guns, torque wrenches, and welding equipment.  Positions and aligns components for assembly, manually or utilizing various material handling tools and equipment.  Analyze assembly blueprints, schematics, and specification manuals, and assists with assembly, wiring and/or machine building operations.  Rework, repair, and replace damaged parts or assemblies.  Fasten and install piping, fixtures, or wiring and electrical components to specifications.  Inspect and test parts and accessories for leakage, defects, or functionality, using electronic, optical, and mechanical test equipment.  Set and verifies clearance of parts.  Set-up and installation of large bearings and slewing rings  Verify conformance of parts to stock list and blueprints, using measuring instruments, such as calipers, gauges, micrometers, indicators, spinning lasers and laser trackers.  Lay-out, drill, ream, tap and cut parts for assembly.  Remove rough spots and finish surfaces to fit  Clean parts or components using hand tools and power tools.  Perform Preventative Maintenance per instructions and update checklists.  Examine parts for defects such as breakage and excessive wear.  Reassemble equipment after completion of inspections, testing, or repairs.  Fabrication of panels and structures, requiring material cutting, clamping, gluing, lifting and painting.  Work with little or no direct supervision in field installation scenarios.  Creative approach to problem solving and ability to exercise good judgement. Required Skills:  Advanced mechanical troubleshooting and basic electrical troubleshooting skills  Working knowledge of system level mechanical testing.  Working knowledge of z-mapping & correction, planar, cylindrical and spherical alignment  Advanced knowledge of assembly tools and mechanical assembly techniques.  Advanced blueprint and schematic reading.  Highly accurate record keeping skills.  Working knowledge of laser alignment methods – spinning/tracker.  Base level system operation.  Capable of solo or leading a team on system field installations and baseline testing.  Forklift, aerial device/elevated platform and rigging certified.  Ability to manually lift/move up to 45 pounds.  Desirable skills/experience:  Set-up, operation, and MDI of CNC machinery  Cut and weld metal to repair broken metal parts, fabricate new parts, and assemble new equipment. MIG and TIG Welding capabilities.  Set-up and operation of metalworking equipment such as milling, drilling, turning and grinding machinery to shape or fabricate parts.  Manufacturing, Mechanical, Industrial, Electrical Engineering background desirable.  This position may require approximately 25-50% domestic and international travel

Must have the ability to obtain or have a U.S. Government security clearance.

Experience Level: 5 years minimum of machine building / assembly experience or a combination of applicable course work and job experience.

Education Level: High School Diploma or GED

Location:  Greater Los Angeles (Torrance, California)

NSI-MI Technologies is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Compensation

Salary Minimum: $60,000

Salary Maximum: $70,000

Incentive: No

Disclaimer: Where a specific pay range is noted, it is a good faith estimate at the time of this posting. The actual salary offered will be based on experience, skills, qualifications, market / business considerations, and geographic location.

AMETEK is committed to making a safer, sustainable, and more productive world a reality. We use differentiated technology solutions to solve our customers’ most complex challenges. We employ 18,500 colleagues, in 30 countries, that are grounded by our core values: Ethics and Integrity, Respect for the Individual, Diversity and Inclusion, Teamwork, and Social Responsibility.
